summary: Starting in 2020, the Affordable Care Act is scheduled to impose a 40% tax on high-cost health plans when an employee's annual cost of coverage exceeds a certain dollar limit. The limit may be adjusted if an employer's workforce—based on age and gender—is likely to have higher than average health costs. The adjustment is to be made based on the costs of the federal employee...
title: Affordable Care Act: IRS Should Mitigate Limitations of Data to Be Used for the Age and Gender Adjustment for the Tax on High-cost Health Plans
